ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I've improved my skill of writing in Spanish and obeying the grammar rules.
I learned more about Spanish Grammar and Vocabulary. Also had practical experience conversing.
I not only gained knowledge of Spanish vocabulary, grammar, and culture, but also gained confidence when it came to speaking the language and communicating with others.
I developed skills that helped me listen and speak in Spanish rather than only read the language.
We covered a lot of grammar and vocab and from this course I gained better skills in writing in Spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class makes you practice frequently which helps you retain the skills you learn. To improve the class, I would include more review sessions of the earlier material towards the end of the semester.
I think that learning the grammar was emphasized heavily, which is important. Unfortunately, I thought I learned less vocabulary in this course compared to previous courses.

One strength of this course was how frequently it met. I felt that meeting four times a week (with a fifth day asynchronous) was very beneficial as the continuous practice of the language helped me improve consistently. I also though the wide verity of assessments (tests, projects, essays, etc.) were nice to have as the gave a more well-rounded picture of improvement. There were no obvious weaknesses that I noted.
I think this course was great, but it could use more short stories/poems to expand vocabulary.

I liked how it was asynchronous on Wednesdays, which made my schedule more flexible because I could do the work at a different time and it was also nice because I could learn at my own pace on those days. It could be improved by making the asynchronous day be Friday.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this course helps you become a more proficient Spanish speaker, reader, listener, and writer.
Yes. I think Spanish is a practical language to learn (especially if the student is living in the US) .
Yes, I would. I felt like the workload was manageable yet organized in a way that made learning efficient.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student who wants to learn about Latino/Spanish culture and more than just the language.
Yes! I learned so much and the professor is so amazing because she really cares about her students understanding the material.
